intro: Ardisia amherstiana var. annamensis, commonly known as the Annamese beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces bright purple berries that are edible for some animals but generally unpalatable to humans. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture.
